intro: Melampyrum roseum f. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth marsh tea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Orobanchaceae. It is characterized by its glabrous (smooth) stems and leaves, which distinguish it from other forms of Melampyrum. The plant produces clusters of small, pink to reddish-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It is typically found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Its botanical features make it a notable species for ecological studies and botanical gardens.
